articles.title: Consider Active ETF RFFC's Long Term Returns
articles.summary: The article highlights the ALPS Active Equity Opportunity ETF (RFFC) as a potentially appealing active ETF due to its flexible investment strategy across small, mid, and large-cap equities and REITs. RFFC employs a bottom-up approach, focusing on dividend-paying stocks and those with high or improving return on capital, and has significantly outperformed its peers over one and five years. With its active management and broad options, RFFC is presented as a worthwhile addition to core investment strategies, entering the second half of 2024.

articles.title: Cohesity completes late-stage $150M funding from IBM and Nvidia, expands IBM partnership
articles.summary: Data management provider Cohesity Inc. has completed a $150 million Series F funding round with participation from IBM and Nvidia Corp., bringing its total raised to $955 million. The funding coincides with an expanded partnership with IBM, focusing on cyber resilience capabilities within hybrid cloud environments. This collaboration integrates Cohesity DataProtect into IBM Storage Defender to enhance data protection, monitoring, management, and recovery against cyberthreats.

articles.title: Lowe’s looks to Nvidia and AI to improve its retail operations
articles.summary: Lowe's is partnering with Nvidia to integrate AI across its retail operations, including digital businesses, supply chain, and in-store experiences. The collaboration aims to enhance customer interactions, empower associates, and optimize store management through technologies such as AI-powered visualizations, digital twins in Nvidia Omniverse, and computer vision for checkout efficiency. Lowe's has been leveraging AI for years and sees ripe applications for the technology in improving both business processes and customer satisfaction.

articles.title: Akamai expands cloud services with dedicated GPUs for media workloads
articles.summary: Akamai Technologies Inc. has launched a new industry-optimized cloud service utilizing Nvidia RTX 4000 Ada generation GPUs, specifically designed for media workloads to enhance video encoding, decoding, and processing. This service aims to provide faster and more cost-effective solutions for media providers compared to standard virtual machines, leveraging Akamai's global edge network. Although optimized for media, the service is also capable of supporting other demanding tasks like generative AI training and inference.

articles.title: The Market Doesn't Like What It Sees From Peraso Inc.'s (NASDAQ:PRSO) Revenues Yet As Shares Tumble 31%
articles.summary: Peraso Inc. (NASDAQ:PRSO) shares have fallen 31% in the last month, contributing to a 93% loss over the past twelve months. The company's low price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 0.2x, significantly below the Semiconductor industry average, reflects concerns over declining revenue and limited future growth compared to the broader industry. Investors are awaiting improved financial performance to justify a higher valuation for the stock.

articles.title: Implications of AI for cloud computing companies
articles.summary: The article explores the significant impact of AI on cloud computing companies, noting that while AI has driven much of the equity market's recent gains, particularly for the "magnificent seven" tech companies, the broader economic benefits may take time to materialize. It highlights cloud computing as a key beneficiary, where AI integration can enhance operational efficiency, decision-making, cybersecurity, and personalized services. The piece also introduces the Fidelity Cloud Computing UCITS ETF as a means for investors to gain exposure to this theme.

articles.title: Applied Materials Rethinks $4B Silicon Valley Project Amid Federal Funding Shortfall
articles.summary: Applied Materials (NASDAQ: AMAT) is reconsidering or may abandon its planned $4 billion R&D facility in Silicon Valley due to a lack of federal funding. The Biden administration shifted focus away from financing semiconductor R&D facilities, impacting companies like Applied Materials that do not directly manufacture semiconductors. This decision jeopardizes the project and has led Applied Materials to consider relocating the facility out of California, despite strong financial performance in Q1 2024.

articles.title: Chip maker SkyWater cancels plans for Indiana plant—at least for now
articles.summary: SkyWater Technology has canceled its plans for a $1.8 billion semiconductor R&D and fabrication facility in West Lafayette, Indiana, which was expected to create 750 jobs. The decision comes as the project was dependent on funding from the CHIPS and Science Act, which SkyWater did not receive. Despite this, Purdue University states SkyWater remains a valued partner for research opportunities, and the Indiana Economic Development Corp. committed incentives, though none were claimed.

articles.title: Alger Launches 2 Transparent Actively Managed ETFs
articles.summary: Fred Alger Management has launched two new transparent actively managed ETFs: the Alger AI Enablers & Adopters ETF (ALAI) and the Alger Concentrated Equity ETF (CNEQ). ALAI focuses on companies involved with artificial intelligence, while CNEQ invests in large-cap growth companies, with a significant allocation to technology. These additions bring Alger's ETF family to five funds, building on their earlier entry into the ETF market in 2021.

articles.title: Best-Performing Stocks for the Quarter
articles.summary: The article identifies the best-performing stocks in Q1, highlighting that while Nvidia is prominent due to AI, a broader range of companies including retailers, utilities, and packaged food companies also performed strongly. It categorizes top performers into overall, undervalued, and moat stocks, providing detailed analysis, Morningstar ratings, and fair value estimates for several key companies.

articles.title: If I Could Only Buy and Hold 1 Vanguard ETF For the Next 5 Years, This Would Be My Top Pick
articles.summary: The article recommends the Vanguard Large-Cap ETF (VV) as a top choice for a buy-and-hold strategy for the next five years due to its low expense ratio, focus on U.S. large-cap stocks like Microsoft, Apple, and Nvidia, and its ability to provide broad diversification. It highlights the ETF's simplicity and stability, making it easier for investors to hold through market volatility compared to individual stocks or more specialized thematic ETFs. The author also notes the subtle differences and near-identical returns between VV and the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF, with a slight preference for VV.

articles.title: AMD Advances Open Source Initiative with MES Firmware Release for Radeon GPUs
articles.summary: AMD announced its plan to open-source the Micro Engine Scheduler (MES) firmware for its Radeon GPUs, enhancing user control and accessibility. This move directly addresses lobbying efforts from companies like Tiny Corp and could facilitate the integration of third-party chiplets. The company also anticipates significant growth from its MI300s, projecting substantial revenue increases in the coming fiscal years.

articles.title: Nvidia drives top-performing ETFs in Q1 as clean energy woes continue
articles.summary: Semiconductor ETFs, heavily weighted with Nvidia, were the top performers in Q1 2024, continuing their momentum from the previous year. Japanese equity ETFs also performed strongly due to a weak yen and rising Nikkei 225. Conversely, clean energy ETFs continued to struggle, facing challenges from high-interest rates and potential policy changes.

articles.title: How Eastman used its data and analytics experience to get started with generative AI
articles.summary: Eastman, a global specialty materials company, leveraged its existing data and analytics expertise to begin implementing generative AI. Instead of a wholesale adoption, they focused on areas where their technical experience could enable deeper functionality and create a competitive advantage. The company is experimenting with generative AI tools for analyzing procurement contracts and sales call notes to extract previously difficult-to-unearth insights and identify cross-sell opportunities.

articles.title: NVIDIA’s Rapid Rise Fueled by Chip Giants TSMC and SK Hynix
articles.summary: The article highlights that NVIDIA's significant market valuation and AI leadership are heavily reliant on its partnerships with semiconductor giants TSMC and SK Hynix. Despite their indispensable roles in manufacturing and developing critical components like advanced GPUs and HBM chips, TSMC and SK Hynix have significantly lower valuations compared to NVIDIA. The KraneShares Emerging Markets Consumer Technology ETF (KEMQ) is presented as a way for U.S. investors to gain exposure to these key enablers of AI technology.

articles.title: These Growth Funds Continued to Shine in Q1 2024
articles.summary: Growth equity funds, especially those with exposure to AI-related stocks, continued their strong performance in Q1 2024, significantly outperforming value funds. While large-cap growth led the way, small- and mid-cap growth funds also fared well. International growth funds also saw gains, although they lagged behind their US counterparts.
